articles.summary: Queen Camilla and her sister Annabel Elliot, an interior designer and antiques dealer, have a strong bond, having stood by each other for decades. Annabel, who has served as King Charles's chief designer of his estates for over 20 years, is reportedly being removed from the payroll after Prince William took over the Duchy of Cornwall. She was employed by the King, then Prince of Wales, and his wife, Queen Camilla, after his 2005 marriage to her elder sister, Charles. Despite this, Annabel has reportedly been not paid for her services as of 2023 to 2024. The Telegraph reports that Annabel received anywhere between £19,625 and £82,272 for her work, and receiving an additional £7,160 to £90,285 each year for stock and furniture. The pair have been seen together more frequently since Annabel's key role in the Coronation as her sister's companion and a pillar of support for her widowed younger sibling.

articles.summary: Kamala Harris, former California attorney general, has been known for supporting affordable housing and has proposed similar policies as a potential presidential candidate. Her proposed Rent Relief Act would offer tax credits to renters who earn below $100,000 and spend over 30% of their income on rent and utilities. This version includes a mechanism from the Treasury to pay the tax credit monthly to eligible households. The second version caps the credit at 100% of small area fair market rents instead of 150% of FMR. This comes as Harris announced the recipients of an $85 million grant under the Pathways to Removing Obstacles for Housing, or PRO Housing, aimed to increase building activity and lower housing and rental costs for families in the U.S. The LIFT the Middle Class Act would provide a refundable tax credit of up to $3,000 per person or $6,000 for married couples who file joint tax returns. Some experts suggest that the LIFT Act might be better for renters than the proposed 5% rent cap increase, which could lead to landlords losing access to tax breaks.

articles.title: Biden must stand up for rules-based trade
articles.description: Science-driven, rules-based trade is under attack, and agriculture stands to lose access to a critical market as a result.
articles.content: Science-driven, rules-based trade is under attack, and American agriculture stands to lose access to a critical market as a result. President Joe Biden must speak up on behalf of corn producers. Other... [4495 symbols]
articles.summary: The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) agreement, which includes a prohibition on any import restriction without scientific basis, has been violated by Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's decision to ban imports of genetically engineered, or "biotech, corn for human consumption. This action violates USMCA and could have severe consequences for U.S. agriculture and consumers worldwide who benefit from American food production. The response from the Biden administration has been slow and unprofessional, and the lack of urgency on trade puts rules-based trade at risk globally. The author of the WASHINGTON EXAMINER calls for President Joe Biden to speak out on this issue.

articles.summary: Karen Hao, contributor for The Atlantic and former foreign correspondent at The Wall Street Journal, has hosted online courses for the AI Spotlight series aimed at empowering journalists to understand the complexities of artificial intelligence and its impacts on society and business. The series aims to provide a crucial understanding of AI's role in shaping power dynamics and societal structures. Hao highlighted the complexity of AI, which includes a wide range of techniques and approaches from simple machine learning algorithms to complex deep neural networks, and the potential for journalists to accurately report these developments accurately. She also highlighted the increasing centralization of authority as Big Tech increases at the expense of emerging innovation. The AI Spotlight Series aims to help journalists understand the implications of AI and its role in informing the public about these developments.

The Park Fire, which quickly spread from 26 square kilometers to over 70 square miles (180 square kilometers), was only 3% contained early Thursday. Powerful winds and lightning strikes from thunderstorms have also caused fires in eastern Oregon, cutting power and fueling them. The largest active blaze in the United States is burning near the Oregon-Idaho border, causing the closure of Interstate 84 near Boise, Idaho. No deaths or damage to structures have been reported. In the Canadian Rockies’ largest national park, a fast-moving wildfire hit the town of Jasper, forcing thousands to flee and causing significant damage. The Durkee Fire, burning near Idaho’s Idaho border, crossed the interstate near Huntington, home to about 500 people, and merged with another large blaze nearby.

articles.title: 83(b) Election: Tax Strategies For Unvested Company Stock
articles.description: With an 83(b) election, you pay tax on unvested shares now. For founders and executives with stock options or restricted stock, it can be a powerful tax planning tool.
articles.content: For founders, employees, and executives with stock-based compensation, an 83(b) election can be a powerful tax planning tool. When you make an 83(b) election, you're opting to pay tax on unvested shar... [7765 symbols]
articles.summary: An 83(b) election, a powerful tax planning tool for founders, employees, and executives with stock-based compensation, can accelerate the taxation of unvested company stock. The election, which minimizes taxable income and controls the timing of it, allows individuals to pay tax on these shares now, instead of when they vest. This includes paying tax on the taxable spread at grant, rather than when the stock vesting requirements. The difference between the exercise (or purchase) price and the current fair market value of the stock is taxable, either as ordinary income (for restricted stock and non-qualified stock options) or for the alternative minimum tax (AMT) calculation (for incentive stock options). The election can be made in conjunction with an early exercise of stock options or profits interests in an LLC or partnership. Startup founders, early employees, executives, and other service providers can also make an 83B election. The key benefit of this election is having more control over your tax situation and equity. An 83B) election can also be made to shift taxable income entirely to more favorable long-term rates. The eligibility period for this election includes qualifying small business stock (Section 1202) and qualifying for tax-free stock sales.

The layoffs will begin in a series of eight waves beginning Sept. 16 and conclude in January 2025. Despite not providing a reason for the job cuts, Optum is open to shifting affected employees to open positions within the company. The firm declined to comment on the layoffs or whether severance pay would be offered. The move comes as part of a larger effort to address a new California law that will increase healthcare wages to a minimum floor of $25 hourly, which was delayed in June due to a budget deficit.

The ranking round is a curiosity of the Olympic Games and involves all 128 archers shooting 72 arrows each on the same field, with total scores producing seedings for individual and team competition. Tokyo Olympian Bryony Pitman finished 41st, Havers 49th and Penny Healey 52nd, with Team GB seeded 11th for the women's team event.

articles.title: Obama to endorse Kamala Harris for president, report says

articles.summary: Barack Obama is reportedly close to publicly endorsing Kamala Harris as the presumptive Democratic nominee for president. The former president has been in regular contact with Harris and plans to endorse her soon, with discussions reportedly ongoing about appearing together on the campaign trail. This endorsement could further boost the Harris campaign, as Vice President Joe Biden is set to give the keynote speech at the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) national convention. Delegates for the AFT voted to endorse Harris’s bid to become the first woman and second African American to serve as president of the United States. Other high-profile Democrats have also endorsed Harris, including Bill Clinton and his wife Hillary Clinton.

articles.summary: Dawn MacCormack, a prison officer at HMP The Mount in Hertfordshire, has been convicted of misconduct in a public office for sharing a significant number of texts with an inmate, Josh Moore. She shared over 4,000 messages and over 90 calls with him. Despite denying misconduct in public office, she admitted two charges of unauthorised transmission of calls or texts. She will be sentenced on 13 September.

The council hopes these points will enable residents to switch to an EV and provide a reliable network to meet growing demand. Chris Pateman-Jones, CEO of Connected Kibb, described the project as a "huge project" that aims to make charging infrastructure accessible for all.

articles.summary: Prime Healthcare has agreed to sell nine Ascension hospitals in Illinois, including those in Joliet, and associated physician practices, post-acute and senior living facilities. This is the latest ownership or name change for St. Joe's, which became Ascension St. Joseph in 2022 when AMITA Health split into two entities and became part of the St. Louis-based Ascension network. The deal includes various senior facilities, including Villa Franciscan in Jolie, Resurrection Place in Park Ridge and Fox Knoll Village in Aurora. Prime Healthcare and two of its doctors were ordered in 2021 to pay $37.5 million to settle allegations of kickbacks, billing for a suspended doctor, false claims for implantable medical hardware, and overbilling.

She was also ordered to complete a 12-month community order, 25 days of rehabilitation activity, and pay £199 in costs and victim surcharge. The incident occurred on February 29 2024, also known as Bachelor's Day or Ladies' Privilege, an ancient Irish tradition where women can propose to men on Leap Year.

articles.title: It may already be too late for the Fed to stop a recession, former central bank president says
articles.description: "Although it might already be too late to fend off a recession by cutting rates, dawdling now unnecessarily increases the risk," Bill Dudley wrote.
articles.content: Cutting interest rates now might no longer be enough to stop a recession, Bill Dudley wrote for Bloomberg, cautioning that delaying cuts for another month will only aggravate the situation."Although i... [3219 symbols]
articles.summary: Former New York Federal Reserve President, Bill Dudley, has warned that it may already be too late for the Federal Reserve to prevent a recession. He suggested that delaying interest rates for another month could exacerbate the situation. Despite the recent cooling inflation and labor data, Dudley believes the Fed should instead cut rates at its next policy meeting. He also noted that macro conditions have worsened, with low consumer savings, decreased housing construction, and waning government-led investing initiatives fading. The three-month average unemployment rate is up 0.43 percentage point from its low point in the prior 12 months, which could trigger a recession, according to Dudley. The CME FedWatch Tool suggests that the odds of a July rate cut are only 7% for the Fed, compared to a near-consensus 88% for September.

Warren, of Leyton, north east London, is also facing charges related to owning or being in charge of a dog dangerously out of control, having custody of a fighting dog, and possession of a bladed article and a Class B drug. The dogs were shot dead by armed police officers after the attack.

articles.title: Ingleby Barwick father and son guilty of hit-and-run killing

articles.summary: A father and son, Martin and Shaun Breeze, have been found guilty of murdering Brian Darby, 60, in a hit-and-run revenge attack in Ingleby Barwick. Darby was killed and three others were injured when Martin Breeze hit them with his van. Shaun was found guilty also of manslaughter and three counts of causing grievous bodily harm with intent. Both men will be sentenced on 2 August. The verdict was reached after four hours of deliberation and jurors found their guilty verdicts following a two-week trial. Both father and sons were also found guilty in relation to their false report of the van being stolen.

articles.summary: Princess Diana's personal letters and cards from her former housekeeper, Violet Collison, are being auctioned at Sworders in Stansted Mountfitchet, Essex. The previously unseen correspondence, which dates back to the early years of Diana's early marriage to Charles, covers a range of crucial stages of her royal life. Collison was the head housekeeper at Park House on Sandringham Estate, where Diana spent her childhood years and witnessed the births of four Spencer children. The most recent example is a letter from Diana thanking Collison for a gift to Harry, which is expected to fetch £800-1,200.

Authorities say damage is ‘significant’ in Canadian Rockies town as firefighters work to save as much as possible.

A fast-moving wildfire has hit the town of Jasper in the Canadian Rockies, causing “... [3768 symbols]
articles.summary: A wildfire has ravaged the town of Jasper in the Canadian Rockies, causing significant damage and causing thousands of people to be evacuated. The fire, which reached a height of 122 metres (400 feet) and moved at 15 metres (50 feet) a minute, is one of hundreds currently burning across Alberta and British Columbia fuelled by a weeks-long heatwave and surge in lightning strikes. The town, which is home to 4,700 residents and draws over two million tourists annually, was evacuated earlier this week due to the threat of two wildfires. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has approved Alberta's request for federal assistance and is coordinating firefighting and airlift assistance.

Despite missing out on the BBC Sports Personality of the Year awards last year due to a perceived snub, Kerr plans to use this as motivation ahead of the Olympics. He also expressed his desire to win gold at the Games.

The biggest additions will be to New England states, with Manchester-Boston Regional Airport in New Hampshire adding daily flights to Orlando and Fort Myers and Fort Lauderdale starting in 2025. Rhode Island's T.F. Greene Airport in Providence will also get winter seasonal flights to Fort Myers, Tampa, and Portland International Jetport in Maine. John Barnett, 62, was ... [11576 symbols]
articles.summary: Boeing whistleblower, John Barnett, was so distressed by working conditions at its South Carolina plant that he suffered PTSD, according to his lawyer Brian Knowles. Barnett, who was diagnosed with PTSD and anxiety after being exposed to a hostile work environment, took his life during a legal battle with the carrier in March. His death came during a break in depositions in his own whistleblower retaliation suit against Boeing. The revelation comes a month after his family filed a lawsuit against Boeing, holding the company responsible for his death. Barnett had previously warned about sub-standard parts being fitted to aircraft on the assembly line and had issued warnings about the 787 Dreamliner and 737 Max models before his sudden death.

articles.summary: There is hope that the Department of Natural Resources (DNR) will loosen walleye regulations on Mille Lacs Lake beyond the one-fish bag limit set to open on Aug. 16. The Department ofNatural Resources (Mille Lac) has reported low walleyer mortality on the lake since the opening of the season began on May 11. The current bag limit allows anglers to keep one walleyed, 21-to-23 inches, starting Aug.16. However, there is speculation that the DNR may extend the bag limit to two walleyes or combine the two-inch harvest slot. The announcement could come as early as Monday evening when DNR fisheries biologists meet with the Mille-Lacs Fisheries Advisory Committee.

articles.summary: Russian and Chinese nuclear-capable strategic bombers patrolled near the U.S. state of Alaska in the North Pacific and Arctic, prompting the United States and Canada to scramble fighter jets. Russian Tu-95MS “Bear” strategic bombers and Chinese Xi’an H-6 strategic bombers took part in patrols over the Chukchi and Bering seas and the North Ocean. The Russian and Chinese bombers were escorted by Russian Sukhoi Su-30SM and Su-35S fighters, and no foreign airspace was violated. The North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) confirmed that the Russian and People’s Republic of China (PRC) aircraft remained in international airspace and did not enter American or Canadian sovereign airspace. The joint patrol had deepened strategic mutual trust and coordination between the two militaries.

articles.summary: N.J. baseball Player of the Year, Luke Dickerson, has signed a record-breaking contract with the Washington Nationals for $3.8 million, the highest-ever in the bonus pool era for a player drafted outside of the first round and the supplemental first round. Dickerson was drafted in the second round, 44th overall by the Nationals in the 2024 MLB Draft and signed for $1.7 million above his slot value of $2,122,200. The contract is the most-ever for a drafted outside the first and supplemental first-round period for a non-first-round player, according to MLB.com’s Jim Callis. The old record second-round pool record was $33.5 million, which the Philadelphia Phillies gave Kevin Gowdy in 2016. Dickenson, a shortstop, hit 18 home runs and was named NJ.com Player of Year after helping Morris Knolls win its second consecutive Group 3 championship and stealing 27 bases.

articles.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron has hosted a lavish lunch with 40 of the world's wealthiest businessmen, including Tesla's Elon Musk, Coca-Cola's James Quincey, AirBnB's Brian Chesky, Youtube's Neal Mohan and Eli Lilly's David Ricks. The event took place six weeks after Macron dissolved parliament after a defeat in European parliamentary elections by Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally (RN). The Macron camp had warned that victory for either the RN or the New Popular Front (LFI), which plan to increase public spending and raise corporate taxes, would damage France's economic stability and deter foreign direct investment. However, data from France's statistics office showed that industry morale unexpectedly dropped in July.

articles.title: India get sleep doctor on board to put performance anxiety to bed
articles.description: India's athletes are being told that plenty of shut-eye could be the foundation for Olympic success and the team has roped in sleep therapist Monika Sharma to keep them at their sharpest in Paris.
articles.content: PARIS, July 25 (Reuters) - India's athletes are being told that plenty of shut-eye could be the foundation for Olympic success and the team has roped in sleep therapist Monika Sharma to keep them at t... [2436 symbols]
articles.summary: India's athletes are being told that sufficient sleep could be the foundation for Olympic success. Sleep therapist Monika Sharma has been appointed to keep them at their sharpest in Paris. She believes that optimised sleep can significantly improve athletes' performance, including their reaction time, accuracy, and immunity. She also aids in memory consolidation and emotional regulation. The Indian Olympic Association has organised three sleep pods at the Athletes Village to supplement their sleep.

articles.title: 10 Best New Arrivals at Ikea for Your Money in August

articles.summary: Iva has revealed that it's not too soon to start selling fall items at Ikea for your money in August, with new Halloween and autumn items available for purchase. The company has also introduced new products from its Kustfyr Halloween collection and Höstagille autumn collection. The Kustmyr pumpkin-shaped LED table lamp, which has a 4.9 rating on the Ikea website, has been praised for its subtle glow and features a face so you can display it in a window and still enjoy it both sides. Other products from Ikea include a pumpkin-themed LED table table lamp and Halloween serving bowls. While some retailers are currently selling Halloween-themed serving plates, most are more expensive than Ikea's Kustlyr serving plate, which costs Ikea at $7.99 each. Additionally, the Höstaagille pie plate, measuring 13 inches, has more room to accommodate freshly baked apple and pies.

articles.content:
An upcoming hearing could decide whether a Dallas County jury’s award of nearly $4 million for the family of a motorist killed after hitting a 18-wheeler stopped on an interstate will be upheld.

Juro... [4436 symbols]
articles.summary: Robert Buntyn, a 24-year-old motorist from Texas, was killed in 2021 after hitting a semi truck stopped on an interstate. A Dallas County jury awarded his family $3.6 million in June, largely due to the negligence of a North Texas trucking company and a truck driver. The lawsuit alleges that the truck stopped due to a mechanical issue and the driver did not deploy flares or triangles to warn oncoming drivers. Despite the trial and jury verdict, a final judgment has not yet been entered. A final hearing is scheduled for August 16. The wrongful death lawsuit was first filed in December 2021 by the family and asked for damages no less than $1 million.

articles.title: House Votes To Establish Task Force On Trump Assassination Attempt
articles.description: The House of Representatives voted unanimously on Wednesday night to establish a task force to investigate the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump earlier this month at a campaign rally in western Pennsylvania.  Rep. Mike Kelly (R-PA) introduced the resolution that passed 416-0 in support. The vote comes as the Judiciary and Oversight Committees have ...
articles.content: The House of Representatives voted unanimously on Wednesday night to establish a task force to investigate the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump earlier this month at a campaign... [2359 symbols]
articles.summary: The House of Representatives voted unanimously to establish a task force to investigate the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump. The resolution, introduced by Rep. Mike Kelly (R-PA), passed 416-0. The task force will investigate all actions by any agency, Department, Officer, or Employee of the federal government, State and Local law enforcement, and private entities related to the assassination of Trump on July 13, 2024. The majority of the 13 members will be selected by House Speaker Mike Johnson (R/LA). The taskforce must issue a final report of its findings to the House by December 13, 2025, including recommendations for legislative reforms to prevent future security lapses.
